summary: This study investigates the relationship between auditor industry specialization and accounting quality within the European Union (EU), particularly following the adoption of International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS). It finds that the mandatory adoption of IFRS correlates with improved accounting quality among various auditor groups, including non-industry specialists and industry specialists at both EU member country and community levels. The research highlights the significant role that industry-specialized auditors play in enhancing financial reporting quality, suggesting that these findings are relevant for regulators both within the EU and beyond. This study is one of the first to explore the impact of auditor specialization on accounting quality in the context of IFRS adoption.
